none.$description: No rounding. Used for strict grids, tables, square elements.

small.$description: Smaller than default. Used for compact components or tighter layouts.

default.$description: Baseline radius. Center point of the scale. In application context (app), used by all stackable form components (button, input, select, textarea) to ensure visual compatibility when composed together (e.g., input + button). In other contexts (site, report), components may use different radius levels based on visual hierarchy. Theme can shift this value (minimal=4px, friendly=8px), but all stackable components shift together, maintaining compatibility.

large.$description: Larger than default. Used for cards, panels, containers that need more visual weight. Optimized for app-default context/theme. Other contexts/themes may override this value.

extra-large.$description: Much larger than default. Used for modals, dialogs, prominent containers. Optimized for app-default context/theme. Other contexts/themes may override this value.

full.$description: Maximum rounding (pill shape). Used for badges, chips, full-rounded buttons.
